gw.api.filters

Class StandardQueryFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.filters.StandardQueryFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.filters.QueryBasedQueryFilter

    public class StandardQueryFilter
extends Object
implements com.guidewire.pl.system.filters.QueryBasedQueryFilter
    This class allows for the definition of new query filters. A query filter is used to modify a query that has already been constructed. One example of this is query-backed ListViews in the UI. In this case, a StandardQueryFilter can be used to define a filter on the ListView.

    A StandardQueryFilter is defind by implementing the {@link gw.api.filters.StandardQueryFilter.QueryFilter} interface. The implementation receives an instance of {@link IQueryBuilder}, to which it may add further restrictions. For example, imagine a query that returns all activities assigned to a user, and a requirement to define a filter to return only "open" activities assigned to that user. Assuming that the Activity entity is the root of the query, then one could define such a filter in the following way:

    new gw.api.filters.StandardQueryFilter( "Open Activities", \ q -> q.compare("Status", Equals, ActivityStatus.TC_OPEN))

    In the above example, the base query "q" is augmented to include only activities with the "open" status. Note that when a query returns a "view entity," that the query is still performed against the primary entity backing the view entity. Therefore, filters may use fields defined on the primary entity, even if those fields aren't defined on the view entity.

    A StandardQueryFilter can be used both on an {@link gw.api.database.IQueryResult} as well as an {@link IQuery}. To apply to an {@link gw.api.database.IQueryResult}, use the {@link gw.api.database.IQueryResult#addFilter(com.guidewire.commons.metadata.types.IQueryFilter)} method. To apply to an {@link IQuery}, use the {@link StandardQueryFilter#filterQuery(gw.api.database.IQuery)} method directly.

      boolean applyFilter(Object obj)

      com.guidewire.pl.system.database.Query<Bean> filterQuery(com.guidewire.pl.system.database.Query<T> query)
      Returns a Query that is like the passed-in query but performs the relevant filtering in the database. Can return a new Query object, the original Query with modifications, or null (indicates that the filtered Query would return no data).
